intro: Carex praecox f. longevaginata, commonly known as the long sheath sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to northern regions of North America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, characterized by its grass-like appearance and rhizomatous growth habit. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered spikes of greenish-brown flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of ponds. This variety is distinguished by its elongated, persistent leaf sheaths that remain throughout the growing season.
